for those of you who want to know of good karaoke playing and writing software look for swift elite to play karaoke with twin mixers and cd=g pro to copy back on to disc.hope this helps

I use a programme called Swift ultrlite it is far less cluttered and easy to use than Swift Elite. You just load ALL your songs via the add folder feature and then using the quick search facility type in either the track number the title OR the artist and all or any variations will pop up and reduce the list as you type more.

YAY, many new cover songs we've discussed me doing in our band are in this torrent, so I can record my practice sessions, and when I "nail" them I can then give them to my band members so they get my "style" down.

PI023 .03 is a good example of this. Almost the whole song is sung by background singers. I prefer a more bare track. I know you have nothing to do with this but I just wanted to rant.
